item.title: Need help on capitalizing the character right after a space in a player's name
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Oh! Lol, it’s because I made a silly mistake. (It is 1:00 am after all :P)

Look:

Char[] charArray = username.toCharArray();
String userEnd;
char[] userChar = new char[12];
for(int i = 0; i < charArray.length; i++) {
  char c = CharArray[i];
  userChar[i] = c;
  if(Character.isWhitespace(c)) { //if 'c' is whitespace
    char f = Character.toUpperCase(c); //then have the whitespace be turned to uppercase. LOLZ
    userChar[i+1] = f;
    i++;
  }
}
userEnd = new String(userChar); 
username = userEnd.trim();

This SHOULD work:

Char[] charArray = username.toCharArray();
String userEnd;
char[] userChar = new char[12];
for(int i = 0; i < charArray.length; i++) {
  char c = CharArray[i];
  userChar[i] = c;
  if(Character.isWhitespace(c)) { 
    char f = Character.toUpperCase(CharArray[i+1]); 
    userChar[i+1] = f;
    i++;
  }
}
userEnd = new String(userChar); 
username = userEnd.trim();

item.title: Need help on capitalizing the character right after a space in a player's name
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

Would anyone know how to make it so when a player logs in, it will capitalize the first letter in their name, as well as the next character after a space if there is one?

So like, “test” would turn to “Test” and “test dude” would turn to “Test Dude” and so on?

I understand how it needs to be done, but I don’t know how to do it. It needs to loop through the player’s name and check for a space. If there is a space in the player’s name, then if the next character is not a space (In case they have two spaces in a row, like “Test Dude”, it will capitalize the next letter. I had a thought and I made this a while ago, but it didn’t work, nor was I expecting it to. But maybe you’ll sort of get the gist of what I was trying to do.

for(int a = 0; a < 12; i++) { String a2 = " "; if(playerName.contains(a2)) { Character.toUpperCase(playerName.charAt(a2+a)); } }
